get.summary: Retrieve all cards

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Filter by card owner.

parameters.name: is_activated
parameters.description: Filter only for activated cards. Defaults to True if not specified

parameters.name: card_program_id
parameters.description: Filter by card program.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned in each page. The value must be between 2 and 10,000. If not specified, the default value 1,000 will be used.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The ID of the last entity of the previous page, used for pagination to get the next page.

200.description: Response with the ID of the async task. Task status can be checked via a GET call to .../deferred/status/<task_id>
Response with the ID of the async task. Task status can be checked via a GET call to .../deferred/status/<task_id>

get.summary: List all receipts of a business

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned in each page. The value must be between 2 and 10,000. If not specified, the default value 1,000 will be used.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Filter for receipts that were created before the specified date. Input need to be presented in ISO8601 format, e.g. 2020-12-02T00:00:00

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Filter for receipts related to transactions which occurred after the specified date. Input need to be presented in ISO8601 format, e.g. 2020-12-02T00:00:00

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Filter for receipts that were created after the specified date. Input need to be presented in ISO8601 format, e.g. 2020-12-02T00:00:00

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The ID of the last entity of the previous page, used for pagination to get the next page.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Filter for receipts related to transactions which occurred before the specified date. Input need to be presented in ISO8601 format, e.g. 2020-12-02T00:00:00

get.summary: Get details of single receipt
Fetch a reimbursement by ID
List all the reimbursements

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned in each page. The value must be between 2 and 10,000. If not specified, the default value 1,000 will be used.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The ID of the last entity of the previous page, used for pagination to get the next page.

parameters.name: sync_ready
parameters.description: Filter for reimbursements that are coded with accounting fields and ready to sync to ERP systems.

parameters.name: has_no_sync_commits
parameters.description: Filter for reimbursements that have not been synced to ERP systems yet.

get.summary: Fetch a single transaction by ID
Retrieves all transactions for the business
get.description: This endpoint supports filtering and ordering. Note that setting multiple ordering parameters is unsupported.

parameters.name: min_amount
parameters.description: Filter for transactions that have larger amount that the given amount. This is a U.S. Dollar denominated amount.

parameters.name: requires_memo
parameters.description: Filters for transactions which require a memo, but do not have one. This can only be set to true.

parameters.name: max_amount
parameters.description: Filter for transactions that have smaller amount that the given amount. This is a U.S. Dollar denominated amount.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Filter for transactions that happens before the given date.

parameters.name: sk_category_id
parameters.description: Filter by sk category.

parameters.name: department_id
parameters.description: Filter by department.

parameters.name: card_id
parameters.description: Filter by card.

parameters.name: order_by_amount_desc
parameters.description: Sort transactions by amount in descending order.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter by transaction state.

parameters.name: expense_policy_interaction_needs_review
parameters.description: Filter for transactions that require expense policy review.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: Filter by location.

parameters.name: order_by_amount_asc
parameters.description: Sort transactions by amount in ascending order.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The ID of the last entity of the previous page, used for pagination to get the next page.

parameters.name: order_by_date_desc
parameters.description: Sort transactions by date in descending order.

parameters.name: has_no_sync_commits
parameters.description: Filter for transactions that have not been synced to ERP systems yet.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Filter by user.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned in each page. The value must be between 2 and 10,000. If not specified, the default value 1,000 will be used.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Filter for transactions that happens after the given date.

parameters.name: expense_policy_interaction_has_alert
parameters.description: Filter for transactions that have expense policy alert.

parameters.name: merchant_id
parameters.description: Filter by merchant.

parameters.name: order_by_date_asc
parameters.description: Sort transactions by date in ascending order.

parameters.name: sync_ready
parameters.description: Filter for transactions that are coded with accounting fields and ready to sync to ERP systems.

shipping_eta.description: Estimated arrival time, presented in ISO8601 format

shipping_date.description: Date on which the card is shipped out, presented in ISO8601 format

categories.description: List of Ramp Category Codes this card is restricted to.

auto_lock_date.description: Date to automatically lock the card.

interval.description: Time interval to apply limit to.

blocked_categories.description: List of Ramp Category Codes blocked for this card.

fulfillment.description: Fulfillment details of a physical Ramp card.

card_program_id.description: Unique identifier of the card program.

cardholder_id.description: Unique identifier of the card holder.

has_program_overridden.description: Whether the card has overridden the default settings from its card program.

spending_restrictions.description: Specifies the spend restrictions on a Ramp card.

categories.description: List of Ramp Category Codes this card is restricted to.

lock_date.description: Date to automatically lock the card. If lock date has passed, set to a future date or to null to unlock the card.

interval.description: Time interval to apply limit to.

card_program_id.description:
Specify a card program to link with.
            This will override the card's spending restrictions with those of the card program.
            Pass card_program_id = None to detach the card's current card program.

            If the card_program_id field is specified, then the card program's changes will override any other changes.
            For example, if both spending_restrictions and card_program_id are passed, then the new spending restrictions
            will match those of the card program (not the passed spending restrictions).

display_name.description: Cosmetic display name of the card.

has_notifications_enabled.description: Flag to set to enable or disable notifications.

spending_restrictions.description: Modify spending restrictions. Only the fields to be modified need to be passed (so fields that will stay the same do not have to be passed).

idempotency_key.description: An idempotency key is a unique value generated by the client which the server uses to recognize subsequent retries of the same request. To avoid collisions, we encourage clients to use random generated UUIDs.

next.description: the query to get to the next page; it is in the format of <BASE_URL>?<new_params>

categories.description: List of Ramp Category Codes this card is restricted to.

lock_date.description: Date to automatically lock the card. If lock date has passed, set to a future date or to null to unlock the card.

interval.description: Time interval to apply limit to.

user_id.description: Unique identifier of the card owner.

card_program_id.description: Alternative method to create a card using a card program. If this value is given, no other attributes (other than idempotency_key) may be given.

idempotency_key.description: An idempotency key is a unique value generated by the client which the server uses to recognize subsequent retries of the same request. To avoid collisions, we encourage clients to use random generated UUIDs.

is_physical.description: Set to true to create a physical card

spending_restrictions.description: Specifies the spend restrictions on a Ramp card.

is_temporary.description: Set to true to create a temporary card

display_name.description: Cosmetic display name of the card.

card_id.description: Unique identifier of the subject card in the deferred task.

error.description: An error message if the deferred task fails.

status.description: Status of the deferred task. It could be one of the following values: STARTED, IN_PROGRESS, ERROR, SUCCESS

id.description: Unique identifier of the deferred task.

data.description: Detailed data of the deferred task.

categories.description: List of Ramp Category Codes this card is restricted to.

lock_date.description: Date to automatically lock the card.

interval.description: Time interval to apply limit to.

id.description: Unique identifer of the card program.

is_default.description: Whether this card program is used as default card program.

is_physical.description: Whether this card program is used for physical cards.

spending_restrictions.description: Spending restrictions associated with the card program.

display_name.description: Display name of the card program.

example.description: Offer a yearly stipend for conferences and courses.

data.description: Offer a yearly stipend for conferences and courses.

is_default.description: Whether this card program is used as default card program.

is_physical.description: Whether this card program is used for physical cards.

spending_restrictions.description: Spending restrictions associated with the card program.

display_name.description: Display name of the card program.

example.description: Offer a yearly stipend for conferences and courses.

user_id.description: Unique identifier of the person who made the transaction.

transaction_id.description: Unique identifier of the associated transaction.

receipt_url.description: Pre-signed url to download receipt image.

id.description: ID that uniquely identifies an accounting field option within Ramp

external_id.description: external id of accounting field option; It should uniquely identify an accounting field option on the client end.

currency_code.description: The type of currency, in ISO 4217 format. e.g. USD for US dollars

amount.description: the amount of money represented in the smallest denomination of the currency. For example, when the currency is USD, then the amount is expressed in cents.

accounting_field_selections.description: List of accounting field options related to the line item.
List of accounting fields related to the reimbursement.

user_id.description: Unique identifier of the person who made the reimbursement.

amount.description: The amount that the payor pays.

line_items.description: List of line items related to the reimbursement.

currency.description: The currency that the payor pays with.

original_reimbursement_amount.description: Original reimbursement amount before the currency conversion.

direction.description: The direction of the reimbursement. It could be either BUSINESS_TO_USER or USER_TO_BUSINESS.

created_at.description: Time at which the reimbursement is created. Presented in ISO8601 format.

id.description: ID that uniquely identifies an accounting field option within Ramp

external_id.description: external id of accounting field option; It should uniquely identify an accounting field option on the client end.

accounting_field_selections.description: List of accounting field options related to the line item.

amount.description: Amount of the line item, denominated in the currency that the transaction was settled in.

memo.description: Free form text regarding the policy violation.

created_at.description: Time at which the policy violation is created, presented in ISO8601 format.

type.description: The dispute type; It could be one of the following values: RESOLVED_BY_RAMP, CANCELLED_BY_CUSTOMER, CREATED_MERCHANT_ERROR and CREATED_UNRECOGNIZED_CHARGE.

memo.description: Free form text regarding the dispute.

created_at.description: Time at which the dispute is created, presented in ISO8601 format.

department_id.description: ID of the card holder's department.

location_id.description: ID of the card holder's location.

department_name.description: Name of the card holder's deparment.

location_name.description: Name of the card holder's location.

accounting_field_selections.description: List of accounting fields related to the transaction.

line_items.description: List of line items related to the transaction.

policy_violations.description: A list of policy violations sorted in descending order by their creation time.

merchant_category_code_description.description: Description about the merchant category code.

disputes.description: A list of disputes sorted in descending order by their creation time.

receipts.description: Receipts listed in ascending order by their creation time, related to the transaction.

merchant_descriptor.description: A merchant descriptor is the name that appears on a customer's bank statement when they make a purchase from that merchant.

original_transaction_amount.description: the original transaction amount before the currency conversion.

accounting_categories.description: Accounting categories related to the transaction.

merchant_category_code.description: Merchant category code is a four-digit number in ISP 18245 used to classify a business by the types of goods and services it provides.

currency_code.description: Currency that the transaction is settled in.

role.description: The employee's role; It could be one of the following values: Admin, Cardholder, Owner, Bookkeeper

department_id.description: Unique identifier of the employee's department

business_id.description: Unique identifier of the company that the employee's working for.

manager_id.description: Unique identifier of the employee's manager

is_manager.description: Whether the employee is a manager

location_id.description: Unique identifier of the employee's location

status.description: The employee's status; It could be one of the following values: INVITE_PENDING, INVITE_DELETED, INVITE_EXPIRED, USER_ONBOARDING, USER_ACTIVE and USER_SUSPENDED

role.description: The employee's role; It could be one of the following values: Admin, Cardholder, Bookkeeper; Note that Owner is not a permissible value.

direct_manager_id.description: Unique identifier of the employee's direct manager

department_id.description: Unique identifier of the employee's department

location_id.description: Unique identifier of the employee's location

role.description: The employee's role; It could be one of the following values: Admin, Cardholder, Bookkeeper; Note that Owner is not a invitable role.

department_id.description: Unique identifier of the employee's department

location_id.description: Unique identifier of the employee's location

idempotency_key.description: an idempotency key is a unique value generated by the client which the server uses to recognize subsequent retries of the same request. To avoid collisions, we encourage clients to use random generated UUIDs.

direct_manager_id.description: Unique identifier of the employee's direct manager

user_id.description: The subject employee's ID of the deferred task.

error.description: An error message if the deferred task fails

status.description: Status of the deferred task. It could be one of the following values: STARTED, IN_PROGRESS, ERROR, SUCCESS

id.description: Unique identifier of the deferred task.

data.description: Detailed data of the deferred task.

business_description.description: A short description of the business.

office_phone_number.description: Office phone number. Must include country code.
